thread.title: Have a 256GB iPhone 7? Here’s how you can double your storage
thread.title_full: Have a 256GB iPhone 7? Here’s how you can double your storage

author: Maren Estrada
title: Have a 256GB iPhone 7? Here’s how you can double your storage
text:
It's pretty fantastic that Apple finally came around and doubled the internal storage on each of its iPhone 7 and iPhone 7 Plus models. So instead of 16GB, 64GB and 128GB you get 32GB, 128GB or 256GB of storage space. Of course, storage is like money in that no matter how much you have, it's never enough. While it'll be a cold day in hell before Apple adds support for memory cards to its iPhone lineup, there are solutions out there that let you expand your iPhone's memory. And now, SanDisk has launched the biggest one yet — the SanDisk iXpand Flash Drive 256GB .
Some highlights from the product page:
The flash drive for your iPhone and iPad Quickly free up space on your iPhone Automatically back up photos and videos when connected Watch popular-format videos directly from the drive (.WMV, .AVI, .MKV, .MP4, .MOV) Designed with a flexible connector to fit through most iPhone cases SanDisk iXpand Flash Drive 256GB (SDIX30N-256G-GN6NE) : $199.99 
Trending right now: 
Google’s Pixel copied the iPhone 6, and it looks like the Pixel 2 will copy the iPhone 7 Man suffers fatal heart attack after catching one of the rarest creatures in ‘Pokemon Go’ This is our best look yet at Samsung’s jet black Galaxy S8 and Galaxy S8+
